summary: This document is a summary of account balances and transactions for a Deutsche Bank account from October 1 to October 31, 2015. It details significant transactions, including large incoming funds and a substantial transfer out of the account, indicating financial activity related to the Epstein case.

persons.name: Amanda Kirby
persons.context: Amanda Kirby is mentioned as the contact for personal assistance regarding the account.

persons.name: Leon D. Black
persons.context: Leon D. Black is referenced in connection with incoming funds to the account, indicating his involvement in financial transactions.

persons.name: Debra R. Black
persons.context: Debra R. Black is also mentioned in relation to incoming funds, suggesting her involvement in the financial activities of the account.

connections.description: Leon D. Black and Debra R. Black are likely related as they share the same last name and are both involved in the same financial transactions.

events.title: Transfer of Funds
events.description: A transfer of $1,250,000.00 was made from the account.

events.title: Incoming Money Transaction
events.description: Two incoming transactions of $5,000,000.00 each were credited to the account.

events.title: Interest Payment
events.description: An interest payment of $9,536.32 was credited to the account.

keyFacts: The account had a beginning balance of $569,814,428.49 on October 1, 2015.
A total of $10,000,000.00 was credited to the account from Leon D. Black and Debra R. Black on October 13, 2015.
A significant transfer of $1,250,000.00 occurred on October 5, 2015.
The ending balance of the account as of October 31, 2015, was $578,573,964.81.
The document includes various service charges totaling $50.00 for the statement period.
